mainEntity.name: How is take-home pay calculated in Ireland?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our Ireland Salary Calculator deducts PAYE income tax, Universal Social Charge (USC), and Pay Related Social Insurance (PRSI) to show your net take-home pay. Calculations follow current Revenue.ie guidelines and include tax credits where applicable.

mainEntity.name: What is the difference between PAYE and USC in Ireland?

acceptedAnswer.text: PAYE is Ireland's income tax system with progressive rates from 20% to 45%. USC (Universal Social Charge) is an additional social charge with rates from 0.5% to 8% that applies from the first euro earned. Both are calculated differently and serve different purposes.

mainEntity.name: How does PRSI work in Ireland?

acceptedAnswer.text: PRSI (Pay Related Social Insurance) is charged at 4% for most employees on earnings up to ‚Ç¨76,744. It funds social welfare benefits and the employer pays an additional 8.8%. Our Ireland calculators include all PRSI calculations for accurate take-home pay estimates.
